Think about what your topic sentence says:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">The story of my attempt to make Chinese hot and sour soup makes me a perfect fit for <em>America&rsquo;s Worst Cooks</em>.</span><br /><br />To choose your support:</p><ol><li>Ask yourself what information can <strong>prove</strong>, <strong>show</strong>, or <strong>explain</strong> what you are saying.</li><li>Choose <strong>specific</strong> support that will convince your reader.&nbsp; return false;\">Ask yourself: Deciding what support to use,&nbsp;Picture it!</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/3/Screen_reader_ask_yourself_deciding_what_support_to_use.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/accessible_icon.png\" style=\"width: 17px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of ask yourself: deciding what support to use, opens in a new tab</span></a></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Gravel Mountain Motel Manager,<br /><br />My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015, was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.&nbsp; The walls were so thin that we could hear the people next door to us snoring loudly all night long.&nbsp; Nobody in my family got a moment of sleep for the entire night.&nbsp; The TV in our room was not working correctly, leaving us with nothing to do in the torrential rainstorm. &nbsp;When we called to complain, no one was available to speak with us.&nbsp; When we did speak with someone, he was rude and unhelpful.&nbsp; He told us, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot;&nbsp; The night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.&nbsp; Please refund the cost of our motel room as soon as possible.<br /><br />Sincerely,<br />Ticked-off Traveler</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Here is your letter with its supporting details and concluding sentence.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Producers:</p><p>The story of my attempt to make Chinese hot and sour soup makes me a perfect fit for <em>America&rsquo;s Worst Cooks</em>.&nbsp; I searched the Internet for an authentic recipe.&nbsp; I had to find a Chinese grocery store to purchase the ingredients.&nbsp; Once I had all the ingredients, I began combining them in a large pot.&nbsp; For some reason, the soup was not thickening.&nbsp;&nbsp; I re-read the recipe and thought there was a typo, so I added two additional <em>tablespoons</em> of cornstarch.&nbsp; When the soup still did not thicken, I added two additional <em>cups</em> of cornstarch.&nbsp; While I stirred, suddenly the soup turned into a solid brick and my spoon froze in the middle of it.&nbsp; I had to throw the entire batch into the garbage can, including the pot.&nbsp; I learned a valuable lesson, though: An amateur shouldn&rsquo;t think he knows better than the person who created the recipe. Doesn&rsquo;t this experience make me a truly awful cook who should be on your show?<br /><br />Sincerely,<br />Awful Cook</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview","inputData":{"mc_2ef3bc80-1ced-90df-77c4-29ef26c92fb5":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"The longest movie of all time is the experimental film <i>Logistics</i>, which is 857 hours long.","fixed":false},{"text":"Most movies start to drag after 90 minutes, and after 2 hours they become unbearable.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This statement is an opinion, not a fact that supports the topic sentence."},{"fixed":false,"text":"At almost four hours long, <i>Gone with the Wind</i> should have been titled <i>Totally Long Winded</i>.","incFeedback":"This statement is an opinion, not a fact that supports the topic sentence."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This statement states a fact that is a certainty.
